Inilah Tempat Paling Sering Hujan di Bumi
01 Nov 2019, 16:07 by Afif Farhan


Selamat datang di tempat yang paling sering turun hujan di Bumi (AFP/Biju Boro)

Mawsynram - Nama desa ini sedikit susah disebut, yakni Mawsynram. Tapi tahukah kamu, inilah tempat paling sering turun hujan di Bumi!Mawsynram merupakan desa di kawasan East Khasi Hills, Meghalaya. Lokasinya di bagian barat India yang tak jauh dari perbatasan dengan Bangladesh.Desa ini cukup sulit ditempuh. Dari kota-kota besar India seperti New Delhi atau Arga bisa naik penerbangan domestik menuju Bandara Guwahati di Kota Guwahati. Tapi setelah itu, harus menempuh perjalanan jalan sejauh 107 km!Suatu perjalanan panjang, untuk mencapai Mawsynram yang mendapat predikat dari Guinness World Records, sebagai tempat paling sering turun hujan di Bumi.


Desa Mawsynram (AFP/Biju Boro)

Dirangkum dari berbagai sumber, Mawsynram mendapat predikat 'Highest Rainfall Annually' yang artinya tempat paling sering turun hujan. Julukan lainnya yakni 'The Wettest Place on Earth'. Catatannya, curah hujan tahunan rata-rata 11.871 mm.Mawsynram mengalahkan Cherrapunji yang juga di India dan hanya berjarak 20 km, serta Tutendo di Kolombia. Ibaratnya begini, hujan yang membasahi Mawsynram dalam setahun mampu membuat lutut dari Patung Yesus di Rio de Janeiro, Brasil yang setinggi 30 meter akan terendam selutut.


Foto: (AFP/Biju Boro)

Mengapa sering turun hujan di Mawsynram?"Yang terjadi adalah setiap kali air berkumpul lebih dari Teluk Benggala, menyebabkan curah hujan di atas Mawsynram, mengarah ke berat, musim hujan yang panjang," kata Sunit Das dari Departemen Meteorologi India.Musim hujan di Mawsynram, jatuh pada bulan Juni sampai September. Kala itulah, jalanan desa di sana tidak akan pernah kering alias selalu basah. Bahkan di siang hari, langit tampak selalu gelap karena mendung.


Foto: (AFP/Biju Boro)

Mawsynram pun menawarkan banyak petualangan. Ada gua, hutan, sampai air terjun Nohkalikai yang merupakan salah satu air terjun tertinggi di India dengan ketinggian sekitar 340 meter!Mau coba mendatangi tempat paling sering turun hujan di Bumi ini?Simak Video "Kapal Wisata Terbalik di India, 12 Orang Tewas"[Gambas:Video 20detik](aff/aff)

This is the most frequent place of rain on earth
01 Nov 2019, 16:07 by Afif Farhan


Welcome to the place that most often rains on Earth (AFP / Biju Boro)

Mawsynram - The name of the village is a little hard to say, Mawsynram. But you know, this is the most frequent place to rain on Earth! Mawsynram is a village in the East Khasi Hills region, Meghalaya. Its location in the western part of India which is not far from the border with Bangladesh. This village is quite difficult to reach. From major Indian cities such as New Delhi or Arga, you can take a domestic flight to Guwahati Airport in Guwahati City. But after that, you have to take a road trip as far as 107 km! A long journey, to reach Mawsynram which received the title of Guinness World Records, as the most frequent rain on Earth.


Mawsynram Village (AFP / Biju Boro)

Summarized from various sources, Mawsynram received the title 'Highest Rainfall Annually' which means the place where it rains most often. Another nickname is 'The Wettest Place on Earth'. Note, annual rainfall averages 11,871 mm. Mawsynram beats Cherrapunji, which is also in India and only 20 km away, and Tutendo in Colombia. Supposing like this, the rain that wet Mawsynram in a year can make the knee of the Statue of Jesus in Rio de Janeiro, Brazil which is 30 meters high will be submerged to his knees.


Photo: (AFP / Biju Boro)

Why does it often rain at Mawsynram? "What happens is that whenever water collects over the Bay of Bengal, it causes rainfall over Mawsynram, leading to heavy, long rainy seasons," said Sunit Das of the Indian Meteorological Department. Rainy season at Mawsynram, falls from June to September. At that time, the village road there will never dry alias always wet. Even in the daytime, the sky always seems dark because it is cloudy.


Photo: (AFP / Biju Boro)

Mawsynram also offers a lot of adventure. There are caves, forests, to the Nohkalikai waterfall which is one of the highest waterfalls in India with a height of about 340 meters!
